snippet: Kim Davis, the county clerk who objects to same-sex marriage will not have to issue marriage licenses while her case goes to a federal appeals court.
abstract: Federal District Court Judge David Bunning rules that Rowan County, Ky, clerk Kim Davis will not have to issue marriage licenses to gay couples while she appeals her case; Davis has objected to issuing licenses on religious grounds.
lead_paragraph: Kim Davis, the county clerk who objects to same-sex marriage will not have to issue marriage licenses while her case goes to a federal appeals court.

headline.main: Kentucky: Clerk Gets Time to Appeal Order to Issue Marriage Licenses
headline.print_headline: Kentucky: Clerk Gets Time to Appeal Order to Issue Marriage Licenses

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
